Marty_Raybon:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2020}} {{BLP sources|date=October 2010}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Marty Raybon | image = RayboBlue.jpg | caption = Marty Raybon | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Marlon Raybon | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1959|12|08}} | birth_place = [[Sanford, Florida]]{{cite web|url=http://www.alabamamusicoffice.com/artists-a-z/r/1603-raybon-marty.html|title=Raybon, Marty|website=www.alabamamusicoffice.com}} | instrument = Vocals, acoustic guitar | genre = [[Country music|Country]], [[Christian country music|Christian country]], [[bluegrass music|Bluegrass]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 1985–present | label = [[Sparrow Records|Sparrow]], Tri Chord, Doobie Shea, Dakota Sky, [[Rural Rhythm Records|Rural Rhythm]] | current_member_of = [[Shenandoah (band)|Shenandoah]] | past_member_of = [[Raybon Brothers]] | website = [http://www.martyraybon.com/ MartyRaybon.com] }} '''Marlon "Marty" Raybon''' (born December 8, 1959) is an American [[country music]] artist. He is known primarily for his role as the lead singer of the country band [[Shenandoah (band)|Shenandoah]], a role which he held from 1985 to 1997, until he rejoined the band in 2014. He recorded his first solo album, ''Marty Raybon'', in 1995 on [[Sparrow Records]].{{cite web |url=http://www.allmusic.com/cg/amg.dll?p=amg&sql=11:09fuxqygldje~T1 |title=Marty Raybon biography |accessdate=January 25, 2008 |last=Hamilton |first=Andrew |work=[[Allmusic]]}}{{dead link|date=August 2021|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Before leaving Shenandoah in 1997, he and his brother Tim formed a duo known as the [[Raybon Brothers]], which had crossover success that year with the hit single "[[Butterfly Kisses (song)|Butterfly Kisses]]". The Raybon Brothers split up in 1997, and Marty Raybon resumed his career as a solo artist. A second self-titled album was released in 2000, followed by 2003's ''Full Circle''. 2006 saw the release of ''When the Sand Runs Out'', which included the single "Shenandoah Saturday Night". ==Discography== {{for|a complete discography of Shenandoah|Shenandoah discography}} ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details !
